entries: The Jiang Jun throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Jiang Jun's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Inspire {@recharge}
entries: All allied creatures within 15 feet of the Jiang Jun gain a bonus to their attack and damage rolls equal to the Jiang Jun's Charisma modifier until the end of the Jiang Jun's next turn.

reaction.name: Dou Shi's Choke
entries: The Jiang Jun adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Jiang Jun must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Jiang Jun chokes the creature for a moment before slapping them back 5 feet, rendering the creature {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Dou Shi's Swirl
entries: The Jiang Jun adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Jiang Jun must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Jiang Jun may make one guandao attack using his fatal swirl trait.

reaction.name: Sifu's Dodge
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Jiang Jun, the Jiang Jun may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Jiang Jun succeeds they dodge back into Sifu's Poise and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

trait.name: Deadly Duet
entries: The Nuxia deals an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature and the Nuxia are not within 5 feet of another creature, besides themselves, that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Nuxia regains 8 hit points at the start of its turn if it has less than half its maximum hit points and has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Hook Trap
entries: Once per turn, the Nuxia may make one of their hooked sword attacks a trap. If the attack misses they grapple the target and may immediately make a hilt spike attack with advantage against it.
However if the trapped attack hits, it deals no damage.

trait.name: Song of the Moon
entries: If the Nuxia successfully hits with all of its melee attacks on a turn, it may use a bonus action to pull the last creature hit by its attacks 10 feet in a direction of the Nuxia's choosing.

trait.name: Crescent Step
entries: The Nuxia may make a single hilt spike attack as part of taking the Dodge action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nuxia makes three melee attacks with its hooked swords. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Hooked Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hilt Spike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Deadly Caltrops {@recharge}
entries: The Nuxia spreads caltrops to cover a 10-foot-square area within 30 feet of them. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage. Until the creature regains at least 1 hit point, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw.
The Nuxia is immune to the effect of the caltrops.

action.name: Infection {@recharge}
entries: The Nuxia chooses a creature within 30 feet to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature, and any other creatures within 15 feet of them at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute, take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Thread of Fate {@recharge}
entries: The Nuxia chooses a creature within 30 feet to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the creature's movement speed is halved for 1 minute.

reaction.name: Echo Strike
entries: If a melee attack misses the Nuxia after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Nuxia may make one hilt spike attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

reaction.name: Mirror Raid
entries: The Nuxia adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Nuxia must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Nuxia may make one hilt spike attack against the creature that made the attack.

trait.name: Winner's Advantage
entries: When the Shaolin hits with a melee attack on its turn, then their next melee attack deals an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage.

trait.name: Shadowstep
entries: The Shaolin may make a single melee attack with its steel-capped staff as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Flying Monkey
entries: If the Shaolin moves at least 10 feet towards a creature and takes the multiattack action on their turn, the Shaolin may replace the first attack with their steel-capped staff with an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Qi Stance
entries: If the Shaolin makes a melee attack on their turn, they may use their bonus action to enter a Qi stance. While in this stance, the Shaolin's movement speed is reduced to 5 feet. The Shaolin may end this stance on its turn (no action required); this stance requires concentration, as if concentrating on a spell.

trait.name: Lotus Leap
entries: If the Shaolin makes a two handed attack with its steel-capped staff while in Qi Stance, the attack has advantage and deals 9 ({@damage 2d8}) additional damage on a hit.

trait.name: Sun Kick
entries: If the Shaolin is in Qi Stance, they may replace one of their steel-capped staff attacks with an unarmed strike with advantage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Shaolin makes three melee attacks with its steel-capped staff. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove. They may also replace one of these attacks with Blink if they are able.

action.name: Steel-capped Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Blink {@recharge}
entries: The Shaolin teleports to an unoccupied space 5 feet behind a creature that is within 10 feet of the Shaolin and makes an unarmed strike against that creature with advantage. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Blessed Projection {@recharge}
entries: The Shaolin chooses an allied creature within 120 feet of itself, it then teleports to an unoccupied space that is within 5 feet of the chosen ally.

reaction.name: Bounding Blossom
entries: If the Shaolin is in Qi Stance they may, as a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against them, force the creature to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Shaolin succeeds they may make a single steel-capped staff attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Shaolin adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Shaolin must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Shadow Deflect
entries: If a melee attack misses the Shaolin after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Shaolin may make one attack using their steel-capped staff with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Zhanhu's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Zhanhu regains 8 hit points at the start of its turn if it has less than half its maximum hit points and has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Winner's Advantage
entries: When the Zhanhu hits with a melee attack on its turn, then their next melee attack deals an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

trait.name: Absolute Amplitude
entries: Once per turn when the Zhanhu makes an attack using their changdao, they may make that attack target all creatures within reach rather than one target.

trait.name: Violent Maneuver
entries: The Zhanhu may make a single melee attack with their changdao as part of taking the Dodge action.
Additionally the Zhanhu may take the Dodge action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Zhanhu makes two melee attacks with its changdao. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Changdao
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) Hiebschaden.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 5 ft., ein Ziel. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) Schaden durch Wucht.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} bis zum Treffer, Reichweite 150/600 Fuß, ein Ziel. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) Stich-Schaden.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Zhanhu adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Zhanhu must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Subduing Counterblow
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Zhanhu after they have taken the dodge action on their turn, the Zhanhu may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Zhanhu succeeds they may make a single unarmed strike against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted; on a hit the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Einmal pro Runde kann der Soldat einer Kreatur, die er mit einem Waffenangriff trifft, 2 ({@damage 1d4}) zusätzlichen Schaden zufügen, wenn sich diese Kreatur innerhalb von 5 Fuß um einen Verbündeten des Soldaten befindet, der nicht {@condition incapacitated} ist.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Beast of Prey
entries: The Warmonger may make either a single two-handed melee attack with advantage using its flamberge bastard sword or a single clawed gauntlet attack as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Corrupted Blade
entries: The Warmonger uses their bonus action to coat their flamberge bastard sword with corrupting energies. The next time the Warmonger hits a creature with a flamberge bastard sword attack that creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with corruption.

On a failed save the creature, and any allies of that creature within 15 feet of them at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute, take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the corruption early on a success.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The Warmonger has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Elixir of Corruption
entries: When the Warmonger hits a creature afflicted by corruption with a melee attack they regain 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points.

trait.name: Power of Corruption
entries: When the Warmonger hits a creature afflicted by corruption with a melee attack they deal an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Preying Claw
entries: Once per turn, when the Warmonger hits a creature with a clawed gauntlet attack they can force them to make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and the Warmonger may use their bonus action to make a flamberge bastard sword attack that automatically hits.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Warmonger makes three melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Flamberge Bastard Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage, or 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Clawed Gauntlet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Corruption Blast {@recharge}
entries: Each hostile creature within 15 feet of the Warmonger must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature, and any allies of that creature within 15 feet of them at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute, take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the corruption early on a success.

reaction.name: Impaling Riposte
entries: The Warmonger adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Warmonger must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

If the attack then misses, the Warmonger may make one flamberge bastard sword attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack. On a hit the target takes the attack damage as normal and is pushed back 10 feet with the Warmonger following the target.
If there isn't space for the target to be pushed back they are instead knocked {@condition prone} and take an additional 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage from the Warmonger clawing at them.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the pikeman can deal an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the pikeman that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Tower Shield
entries: Whilst wielding this shield, if the pikeman is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it can use its reaction to take no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, interposing the shield between itself and the source of the effect. Additionally it counts as being in half cover against ranged attacks whilst wielding this shield.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Steel Will
entries: The Gryphon has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Gryphon's Shove
entries: The Gryphon may replace their first attack on their turn with an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and pushed back 5 feet.

trait.name: Dauntless Chase
entries: If the Gryphon moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with the next Bardiche attack it makes on the same turn, it can force that creature to succeed a {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice). On a failed save, the creature is moved to within 5ft. of the Gryphon on the opposite side to where they were, be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and knocked {@condition prone}. Large creatures have advantage on the saving throw; Small or smaller creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw.

If the creature succeeds the Strength saving throw the Gryphon stops adjacent to the creature. If the creature succeeds the Dexterity saving throw the Gryphon continues moving past the creature for 10 feet before stopping.
This cannot be used on the same attack as the Forceful Swirl or Soul Cleaver traits.

trait.name: Forceful Swirl
entries: The Gryphon may make their first Bardiche attack on their turn target all creatures within reach rather than one target.
This cannot be used on the same attack as the Dauntless Chase or Soul Cleaver traits.

trait.name: Veteran's Kick
entries: The Gryphon may replace their third Bardiche attack on their turn for an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and pushed back 5 feet.
If the unarmed strike hits, the Gryphon may make one Bardiche attack with advantage as a bonus action.

trait.name: Soul Cleaver
entries: The Gryphon may make a single melee attack with its Bardiche as part of taking the Dodge action.
This cannot be used on the same attack as the Dauntless Chase or Forceful Swirl traits.

trait.name: Winner's Advantage
entries: When the Gryphon hits with a melee attack on its turn, then their next melee attack deals an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Gryphon makes three melee attacks with its Bardiche. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Bardiche
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stern Stare {@recharge 5}
entries: The Gryphon chooses one creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Draconite Bolt {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. On a hit, each creature friendly to the Gryphon within 30 feet of the target regains 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hitpoints.

action.name: Draconite Cleanser (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Gryphon lights and throws a bomb of odd alchemical origin at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 3d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.
For the next minute, each creature friendly to the Gryphon within 10 feet of the chosen point at the start of their turn regains 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hitpoints.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Gryphon adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Gryphon must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Brave Devotion
entries: The Kyoshin has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Aoarashi
entries: The Kyoshin may replace their second shikomizue blade attack on their turn for a shikomizue scabbard attack. On a hit, in addition to the damage, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.
If the shikomizue scabbard attack hits, the Kyoshin may make one shikomizue blade attack with advantage as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sajin-Arashi
entries: The Kyoshin may make a single melee attack with its shikomizue blade as part of taking the Dodge action.

Additionally the Kyoshin may instead make an unarmed strike as part of taking the Dodge action, kicking the target. On a hit, the creature takes 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Kaze Stance
entries: The Kyoshin can use its action to assume this defensive stance; if it has taken the attack or multiattack action on its turn, it may do this as a bonus action. Whilst in this stance the Kyoshin's movement is reduced to 5 feet, it gains +3 to its AC and may only take the Fujin Cuts action and the Tengukaze reaction.

The Kyoshin can exit this stance as a bonus action on their turn; they automatically exit this stance after they take the Fujin Cuts action, use the Tengukaze reaction or if they are {@condition grappled}, {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition stunned} or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Hikari to Kage
entries: When the Kyoshin hits with an attack using their shikomizue blade while in Kaze Stance or as part of the Crushing Counterstrike reaction, the creature takes an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing damage at the start of their next turn and the Kyoshin regains hit points equal to that additional damage.
Multiple instances of this effect stack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Kyoshin makes two shikomizue blade attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Shikomizue Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shikomizue Scabbard
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fujin Cuts (Only in Kaze Stance)
entries: The Kyoshin makes a shikomizue blade attack against a creature within range. If the attack hits, they can make an additional shikomizue blade attack against the same creature as part of this action. The Kyoshin may make up to four attacks this way in one turn.

reaction.name: Crushing Counterstrike
entries: While not in Kaze Stance, as a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Kyoshin, the Kyoshin may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Kyoshin succeeds they may make a single shikomizue blade attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Tengukaze
entries: While in Kaze Stance, as a reaction to a creature missing a melee attack against the Kyoshin, the Kyoshin may take the Fujin Cuts action against the creature as part of this reaction. The first attack of the Fujin Cuts action is made with advantage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: While not in Kaze Stance, the Kyoshin adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Kyoshin must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Pirate makes two cutlass attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Cutlass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Trick Shot {@recharge}
entries: The Pirate makes a pistol attack. On a hit, the shot ricochets and the Pirate may repeat the attack against another creature within 10 feet of the the previous target; it may repeat this way a number of times up to the pirate's Dexterity modifier.

action.name: Pocket Bomb {@recharge 5}
entries: The Pirate can light and throw a black powder bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Gundpowder Surprise {@recharge}
entries: The Pirate fires a hand cannon at a point up to 30 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, be pushed 10 feet away from the point and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Close Quarter Fighter
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on ranged attack rolls the Pirate makes with its pistol.

trait.name: Sea Wolf's Glide
entries: The Pirate may make a single melee attack with its cutlass as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Pistol Blast
entries: Once per turn, when the Pirate hits with an attack using their cutlass they may immediately use their bonus action to make an attack with their pistol or trick shot. On a hit, in addition to the damage, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.
If the pistol or trick shot attack is against the same creature the Pirate hit with their cutlass attack, it has advantage.

trait.name: Walk the Plank!
entries: Once per turn, the Pirate may make one of their cutlass attacks with a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, they add +10 to the attack's damage and may immediately use their bonus action to push the creature 5 feet away from themselves.
This cannot be used on the same attack as the Sea Wolf's Glide trait.

trait.name: Sea Legs
entries: The Pirate has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Pirate adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Pirate must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: Donning or doffing this glove-like weapon requires an action and you may hold another object in the same hand as the cestus. Unarmed strikes deal {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage whilst the cestus is worn.

entries.name: Special
entries: When wielding this weapon you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action when you take the attack action.

entries.name: Special
entries: You require a Strength score of 15 or higher to use this weapon effectively, else your attacks have disadvantage.

entries.name: Special
entries: You require a Strength score of 17 or higher to use this weapon effectively, else your attacks have disadvantage.

entries.name: Special
entries: When wielded with one hand this weapon gains the finesse property.

entries.name: Special
entries: When you hit with an attack with this weapon, you can make another attack as a bonus action. However it deals {@damage 1d8} damage on a hit instead of {@damage 1d12}.

entries.name: Special
entries: Once per turn, you may make one of your attacks with this weapon a trap. If the attack misses you grapple the target and may immediately make a hilt spike attack with advantage against it. This attack deals {@damage 1d4} piercing damage on a hit.
However if the trapped attack hits, it deals no damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: This sickle-like weapon has a chain with a weight at the end. When you make a ranged attack by throwing the kusarigama you can pull the weapon back to your hand by the chain as part of the attack.

entries.name: Special
entries: Whilst wielding this weapon you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC against one melee attack that would hit you; to do so, you must see the attacker and be wielding the weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: The scabbard of this sword may also be used as a weapon; when you are holding the shikomizue and its scabbard in each hand they are treated as light weapons. On a hit the scabbard deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: You can draw and throw up to 2 kunai as part of an attack when you take the attack action; for each thrown above the first you add an additional damage die.

entries.name: Special
entries: You can draw and throw up to 3 shuriken as part of an attack when you take the attack action; for each thrown above the first you add an additional damage die.

item.name: Plated Chainmail
entries: Made of interlocking metal rings and segments of metal plate, plated chainmail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows with the metal plates worn over larger flat sections of the body. The suit includes gauntlets and greaves.

item.name: Segmented Plate
entries: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather along with a helmet, pauldrons, gauntlets and greaves. Although it leaves the joints relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered provided they are strong enough to manage its weight.

entries.name: Special
entries: When wearing this armor, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.
If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 13, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

item.name: Wooden Curiass
entries: This armor consists of a fitted wooden chest piece worn with supple leather along with a helmet, pauldrons, gauntlets and greaves; with some variations featuring slats of wood used for reinforcement. Although it leaves the joints relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered thanks to the lightweight material.

item.name: Metal Curiass
entries: Metal curiasses consist of several large shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It includes arm and leg protection consisting of metal vambraces and greaves that are attached with leather straps.

entries.name: Special
entries: If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 13, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

item.name: Buckler
entries: A small shield about the size of a plate that is made from metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 1. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

entries.name: Special
entries: Whilst wielding this shield you are able to use two hands to attack with weapons that have the versatile property. Additionally you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC against one melee attack that would hit you; to do so, you must see the attacker and be wielding the buckler.

item.name: Tower Shield
entries: A tall shield almost the size of a person that is made from strong wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

entries.name: Special
entries: Whilst wielding this shield, if you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.
Additionally if you move no more than half your movement speed on your turn, you count as being in half cover against ranged attacks whilst wielding this shield.
If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

item.name: Draconite Bolt
entries: A crossbow bolt made from a curious material with odd alchemical properties. Whenever you hit an object using this ammunition, each creature friendly to you within 30 feet of your attack's target regains {@dice 2d4} hitpoints.

item.name: Draconite Cleanser
entries: A bomb of odd alchemical origin. As an action, you can light and throw the bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (with a DC equal to 8 plus your proficiency plus your Dexterity modifier) or take {@dice 3d4} fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.
For 1 minute afterwards, each creature friendly to you within 10 feet of the chosen point at the start of their turn regains {@dice 1d4} hitpoints.

item.name: Fire Flask
entries: A simple glass flask containing a fiery, volatile liquid. You can throw the flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away as an action on your turn. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (with a DC equal to 8 plus your proficiency plus your Dexterity modifier) or take {@dice 5d4} fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of your next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a DC 13 Dexterity save or take {@dice 3d6} fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

item.name: Fire Trap
entries: A small portion of black powder surrounded by a flammable liquid with a pressure plate on top of the casing. You can set up the trap on the ground as an action. A creature that steps on the plate and any others in a 5 foot radius must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 5d4} fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the triggering creature's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a DC 13 Dexterity save or take {@dice 3d6} fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

item.name: Nail Bomb
entries: A small portion of black powder surrounded by many metal spikes with a pressure plate on top. You can set up the bomb on the ground as an action. A creature that steps on the plate and any others in a 5 foot radius must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 4d4} piercing damage.
Creatures that fail the Dexterity save take an additional {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage at the start of their next turn. On a successful save the damage is halved.

item.name: Pugno Mortis
entries: A crude black powder bomb. As an action, you can light and throw a black powder bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (with a DC equal to 8 plus your proficiency plus your Dexterity modifier) or take {@dice 3d6} fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

item.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: A small orb designed to explode on impact and obscure a person's escape or creature confusion. As an action you can throw the smoke bomb at the floor, and on impact it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

item.name: Steel Plates
entries: A set of metal plates, such as arm and shin guards, designed to bolster the defence of lighter armors. If you wear these steel plates while wearing light armour or no armour, and using no shield, your AC increases by 1.

entries.name: Hidden
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks to conceal this weapon.

entries.name: Monk Weapon
entries: A weapon with this property is included in the weapons that you can use with the Monk's Martial Arts feature and Monks are proficient with this weapon in addition to their other weapon proficiencies.
